Posts.Content: I am 49 and I also was diagnosed with DCIS. I had the lumpectomy in December which wasn't enough and a mastectomy in January with the tram flam reconstruction. I'm glad I got the mastectomy but if I could do it again, I would pass on the tram flam reconstruction. I did not have radiation and my doctor advised against tamoxifen. He said the side effects outweigh the benefits. Any thoughts out there on the benefits/ side effects of tamoxifen?
Posts.Title: DCIS questions

Posts.Content: Suggi Thanks for your replies. My lymph nodes were clear. I will check on how big my margins were. Re the tamoxifen, my family doctor advised that she would go on it if she were me. She thinks the younger you are, the more aggressively you should try to prevent possible cancer. If the cancer ever came to the other breast I'd always regret not taking the tamoxifen. If you had cancer in one breast, the chances of getting it in the other goes up 1% each year. I'm still on the fence. Bonnie
Posts.Title: DCIS questions

Posts.Content: Suggi You are right about asking questions. I had read somewhere about not getting blood pressure taken on the mastectomy side but I had to tell that to the nurse in the hospital. I didn't realize that I should never draw blood from that arm forever either. Bonnie
Posts.Title: DCIS questions

Posts.Content: Would you take tamoxifen as a preventative measure for the existing breast? The chance of cancer for the existing breast goes up one percent each year. Bonnie
